Message.Msg: I wasn't addressing you, you nosey little no-account. Sit there and stay shut up until I tell you I am interested in something you have to say.

...“Now, the people that became "casualties" of the neglect from Quackmo & Bloomers ... I wonder why they didn't have the fore-sight that the marathon is always a perfect "soft target" for mass casualties !! Oh, they're Libs (I forgot). What ever happened to due-dilligence ? Is it not required on their watch ? Do they know, or have they forgotten about 9/11 .. have they learned NOTHING from the past !!.” Well, jon, I believe that unlike you, who has obviously learned nothing from the past, (particularly your geography class in 4th grade), they both learned that the Boston Marathon is usually held in the state of Massachusetts, some two hundred plus miles north of NYC, and out of the jurisdiction of the Mayor of NYC and the Governor of NY. And with another brazen display of your total ignorance, you really need to retire ALL of your aliases, put down the bottle and refrain from repeatedly making a complete buffoon out of yourself. I do believe you’re in a state of flux, son. You’re morphing from simply a happy go lucky imbecile into a raving lunatic, intent on, and well on your way to, embarrassing yourself into extinction. Do your own due diligence and get yourself admitted before it’s too late.

Hey investupid. Haven't heard you whine here for a while. So, what's with the new screen name? This ones going to be tough to work with investurd. Couldn't you come up with something easier for us to work with investdouche. What's your problem invester952? Are you bored in your mothers basement again? Get a life why don't you.
What in the he** is wrong with you?

Topic.Title: Oh no say it isn't so!

Message.Msg: Talk about your fluxes all you want, Jon. Until you learn the difference between Boston and New York I don't want to hear you discuss America again.

Seems like most of the doctors are from India. Obama care will require more because what they will be paying doctors will not even repay the student loans for anyone going through medical school in the USA.
Don't make me cry. I am a tax preparer and find that most immigrants know more about the EIC than they do about the USA.
HUH? How did you arrive at your conclusion that NY or NYC had anything to do with this? Are you being influenced by 'ricky research'?

why should charitable work in another country be exempted from income in the USA? Your logic please? Is charitable work in any country a deduction from taxes in other than ones home country? Are your charitable contributions a financial decision or a human needs response?

Message.Title: Are Ricky and Echo really front names for an organization?
Message.Msg: So much of what they post is left wing garbage and they seem to have an endless supply. Have you noticed how voluminous their responses are. I suspect it is a full time job for maybe 20 or 30 people paid by your tax dollars.

From the tax returns I have prepared for immigrants it appears that the "charities" you refer to are relatives and they are listed as dependents even if they only sent them a few bucks. THEY GET ALL THE TAX BREAKS THEY CAN INVENT.

Topic.Title: Are Ricky and Echo really front names for an organization?

Message.Msg: It's obvious here and on other boartds that there are paid shills that post many times a day. There was one site I used to visit that obviously had a tout for the stock. The same name was used 24 hrs. a day pushing the shares. Short of giving name, rank and serial number I identify myself as a share holder of about 6,200 shares. I'm a retired outside plant worker who worked for PT&T until 1983. I took an early retirement when the Bell system was broken up.. I've had personal experience in politics and have read many books on finance. I am a Korean War Vet and two of my kids are eligible for VFW membership. One has nearly 30 years combined active and active reserve duty. I quit believing "Big Bubba" during ther Korean War. In the sixties I met a retired Army Col. that put me on a whole different track. He was captured in No. Africa and spent 18 mos. in a POW camp.

I have relative that worked in the New York Mayors office. She has utter contempt for the whole gang there. She held a rather high position . She also knows that New York banks actually control this whole country.

Topic.Title: Are Ricky and Echo really front names for an organization?

Message.Msg: Wilkie, why do you even bother with Tollers and Troublemakers? They are on par with the Spammers. Use "Ignore" and be done with them. If you leave them alone, eventually they go away. You should know by now they thrive on rattling cages. It's far more important for you to work on getting the 47.00 ADP back to respectability. Mrs. Wilkie would feel a lot better knowing you are scoring big with the bucks in what you do best, rather than jerking around with a bunch of agenda minded fools.

Topic.Title: Are Ricky and Echo really front names for an organization?

Message.Msg: I got out of the army in December 1947 and was afraid they would call me back for Korea but they didn't. Guess they figured I had enough or else maybe they knew how useless I was. I would sure like to know more about the "different track" the Col put you on.

I don't expect an answer to this Wilkie, but I gotta ask anyway. How did you get from being an auto mechanic from the garage you said you owned to being a CPA? That is quite a career change... Not to overlook your being a financial adviser on the side. Are there any other vocations in your résumé?

...right, jon...blame it on an imaginary friend. The only thing worse than you being so stupid, is that you're an even bigger coward, too afraid to man up when you mess up. I guess it was just another April Fool’s day joke, right? You seem to have a reoccurring problem with dates. But, I can see how you could confuse the two…let’s see, The Boston Marathon, the first big one of the season in the U.S., is always run on Patriots Day, and they call it The Boston Marathon because it’s held in Boston (of all places.) “I was moblie last night when I realize it was Boston &.called her back, she was still thinking NY.” (Boy, I bet she was really happy when you straightened her out…what a hero.) So between 3:50 p.m. yesterday, and sometime last night, you had no idea where this tragedy had happened because…why, exactly? What, are you institutionalized with no access to news? Did your parents have you locked in the potato cellar in the basement? How is it that you’ve apparently found the only female friend in the world who is as stupid as you are? And where was she…in a sensory deprivation tank at the spa for 6 hours? Good god, man, I’d bet even your dog knows the Boston Marathon is in Boston. Well, don’t worry too much about it. Just switch aliases and try to blame me or ricky. Truthfully, we can overlook your consistent lack of attention to detail. As I said, it’s easy to get the two confused. The Boston Marathon, held on April 15th this year, and the forthcoming New York Marathon which is just around the corner on… on…on…oh, my, jon, that’s not until November 3rd. You really are goofy. Now, a quick quiz. Next week there will be another large marathon. It’s called The London Marathon. For two free tickets to the Fluvanna County Gun Show, a Tea Party bumper sticker reading, “You’re never too stupid to join the Party’, a Beauregard the Wonder Dog flea collar for your puppy and a hat worn by Doris Ziffel…tell us…where is The London Marathon held? (One clue because of your single digit IQ…it’s NOT Ontario.)
...ah, locked in the potato cellar in the basement it is, then. Thanks for clarifying.

Topic.Title: Are Ricky and Echo really front names for an organization?

Message.Msg: It is amazing to me that you would think that.

You may not expect an answer but it is a good question and deserves a good answer.. It was 1971 and I made the mistake of giving an honest answer to a franchisee of my employer (Sir George's Smorgasbord). He had been waiting over a year after paying his $25,000 franchise fee and asked me when he would likely see some action on his franchise. He was not the only one waiting and, from my vantage point, I knew that the company was using the franchise fees for operating capital. I told him that it was doubtful that he would ever see any action. (he didn't) I was fired. I was 43 and obviously didn't get good recommendations from my previous employer. I had tinkered with mechanical work ever since I was 7 and built my first bike with parts from a trash bin at a bicycle shop two blocks from my house. While I was looking for another job a friend from church asked me if I could fix his VW Square-back. I did and he was so pleased with the work and the low price he sent a couple of his friends. Dido with those two. Within a few weeks I had VW's parked in front of my house, some without engines while I was rebuilding them. I lived in an upscale area in Yorba Linda, CA. and, although none of my neighbors had complained, I didn't think it was going to be long before they did. So I rented a small shop a couple miles away and I hired a young man to help me. That lasted a little over a year and I moved to a larger shop and hired two more mechanics. A couple years latter I rented the adjacent shop and I was doing very little mechanical work myself. I spent my time setting up a machine shop to do work in house that we had been sending out. In 1982 I moved to an 8,000 SF shop in Placentia and soon had 8 mechanics all working on air cooled VW's. We were rebuilding and installing 3 engines a day. Five years later the VW craze was coming to an end and we were branching out into all other cars. I didn't like it so I sold the business and retired.
Now that's voluminous. . .

...really. A simple, "well grease monkey to CPA (car parking attendant) is not really that much of a stretch" would have sufficed. You mean I could have had you fix my '73 VW van (picked up in Hannover in the fall of '72 - the very first "oriental blue" VW van on the road) and you'd have done my taxes while I dined on smorgasboard while I waited? While I'm not certain I'd want you to mess with my car, my food or my finances, you are one well rounded dude, wilkie.

Topic.Title: June 41 calls are selling for 14 cents

Message.Msg: Hey Wilkie. Got your response to my question. Next time, please use paragraphs to make it easier to read. Anyway, you really didn't clarify how you got to be a CPA and financial adviser after the mechanic gig. The way you went from a home-based VW mechanic in your garage to opening a shop in Placentia was very interesting. I bet your Y.L. neighbors loved seeing you tinkering away with all the cars you worked on every day. Your street must have looked like a used car lot. Knowing a little about the VW 300 series with electronic fuel injection, you had to be damn good at repair. They weren't easy to service. It was nostalgic to see you mention Sir George's Smorgasboard. Hadn't seen that name in quite a while. I think there was one in the Pasadena area that I went to a time or two. I preferred Perry Boys Smorgy on Colorado Blvd. though. I'm sure I'm not the only one to be interested in how you got into tax prep and learning your option trading thing, so please elaborate on that if you don't mind. I also have another question or two. How come you moved from O.C. To Hesperia (usually people move from places like Hesperia to O.C.) and do you consider yourself a professional "Shorter"?

Zonbac98, thanks for clarifying. Your mis type and subsequent apology make you stand above posters, especially the new organization of incompetents. Glad to see you are back on track!

Message.Msg: While this is all very interesting, did you happen to catch the critique of the Reinhart-Rogoff study released today? This is the study Paul Ryan cites in his budget to justify his cuts, as well as being used to justify austerity programs worldwide. Do a search for "Researchers Finally Replicated Reinhart-Rogoff, and There Are Serious Problems." ". . .all I can hope is that future historians note that one of the core empirical points providing the intellectual foundation for the global move to austerity in the early 2010s was based on someone accidentally not updating a row formula in Excel." --Mike Konczal

Message.Msg: Who's the astute investor with two names Danny? I use two names, is that a reference to me? What do you mean by a 'new T rate LD' and what is the 'new organization' you write about. Please clarify. Thanx.

..."The lady doth protest too much, methinks” – William Shakespeare to jon “I did turn the TV on for maybe 30 or 45 sec, but got angry as hell and shut it off.” – jon, explaining how he briefly watched the Boston Marathon, with pictures of people being blown apart, only to say, well let’s not watch that anymore, but, suddenly, btw is that happening here?…like, outside? Nearby?…OMG, should I care enough to see where this is happening…Oh, I’m in such a state of flux!! (Or I’m welding) Was that an arm that sailed by my window? I don’t live anywhere near New York of Boston, but why in the world did I turn off the TV???? True, I was watching Nicleodeon very near the comedic denouement…but…suddenly denouments (bad plural – self sic myself for laziness) are no longer comedic. The phrase has come to mean that one can "insist so passionately about something not being true that people suspect the opposite of what one is saying” Jon, you once again, unintentionally clearly define, wacked (not whacked). Just knockin’ round the zoo…bars on all the windows…

Topic.Title: Are Ricky and Echo really front names for an organization?

Message.Msg: The Col. put me in touch with a lady that had been thrown in jail during WW2 for "sedition" by FDR. She and some others spent most of WW2 in prison without a hearing. After the war a judge let them all go and stated that it wasa the worst miscarriage of justice he'd ever seen. Thjis Col. had also visited a so called "extermination Camp where some escaped U. S. prisoners had been taken. As senior officer in his own camp he was accorded the privilege. He later read articles about this camp that he said were totally false. His name was Thomas Drake. of San Diego, CA.
